business.headline: S&P 500 hits lowest level in one year as hopes for Trump tariff relief fadeThe S&P 500 reached its lowest level in nearly a year after it reversed a strong morning rally, as hopes faded for any concessions or delays on President Donald Trump's global tariffs on US's trading partners set to come into effect on April 9.

US markets gain sharply on hopes of tariff talks: Will Dalal Street continue rally?If Wall Street wraps up today's session on a strong note, it could deliver a big dose of confidence to investors worldwide, especially in Asian markets.

US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Opting for new tax regime? Know about this Rs 7,000 post office savings benefitAs per a government notification issued back in 2011, interest from post office savings accounts is exempt under Section 10(15) of the Income Tax Act.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on global recovery and RBI rate cut expectationsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 1,089.18 points to close at 74,227.08, while the NSE Nifty5o gained 374.25 points to end at 22,535.85.

RBI MPC to announce decision on April 9: Will there be a rate cut?Since the last MPC meeting, held in February 2025, a lot of things have changed, both positive and negative. While inflation has come down, and growth has started to pick up, there are fresh worries about the global economy.

'Economic nuclear war': Billionaire business titans slam Trump's tariff gambitDonald Trump's tariff agenda is fracturing elite support, with top businessmen — from Bill Ackman to Jamie Dimon — warning it risks recession, inflation, and global instability.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia on Indian engineers: '99% start giving gyaan'Sabeer Bhatia pointed out that in India, people respect those who talk business, not those who write code or build software. This mindset, he says, is stopping India from becoming a hub of innovation.

Sensex up 1,600 points: Which stocks are driving the rally on Dalal Street?Markets saw a huge rebound from yesterday's crash as they staged a robust recovery as no stocks on the Sensex of Nifty50 traded in red in the afternoon session.

Trump's tariff war may backfire, says JPMorgan CEO, urges stronger India tiesJPMorgan CEO, Jamie Dimon, explained that higher costs of imported goods would affect consumers, while increased demand for local products could also drive prices up.

Unified Pension Scheme: Centre studying global models to manage UPS pool corpusThe government aims to create proper rules for investing the extra contribution made by it in a separate pension fund called the pool corpus under the newly launched Unified Pension Scheme (UPS).

Japan's Nikkei leads Asia's recovery as hopes rise for softer tariff approachA 5.6% rebound in Japan's Nikkei far outpaced other regional markets, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer tasked with leading trade negotiations with Tokyo.

entertainment.headline: Producer Salim Akhtar, who launched Rani Mukerji, diesProducer Salim Akhtar died on April 8. He is survived by his wife, Shama Akhtar, and their son, Samad Akhtar.

Hulu outage hits thousands after Handmaid's Tale premiereHulu experienced a major outage on April 8, affecting over 13,000 users. Login and streaming issues were reported after The Handmaid's Tale premiere. Hulu advised basic troubleshooting and device restarts.
Kunal Kamra 'would rather check into mental hospital' than be on Bigg BossComedian Kunal Kamra shared a post on social media and revealed that he has been approached for the new season of Bigg Boss.

Odela 2 trailer: Tamannaah Bhatia as Shiva Shakti is ready to take on evilTamannaah Bhatia-starrer Odela 2 trailer released today, April 8. The supernatural thriller by Sampath Nandi will release in theatres on April 17.

Malaika Arora stuns with her dance moves on Roop Suhana on Hip Hop India 2. WatchActor Malaika Arora impressed fans with her moves again in a new video. The actor is judging the show with Remo D'Souza.

Actor Tillotama Shome gets emotional over director's remark and proving him wrongActor Tillotama Shome recently recalled a director's remarks on money and how she proved him wrong. The actor, in an interview, got emotional while recalling the incident.

Lenin title glimpse: Akhil Akkineni breaks away from lover boy imageThe title glimpse of Akhil Akkineni's upcoming film Lenin was unveiled on his birthday by father and actor Nagarjuna. The one-minute teaser hints at a powerful comeback of the actor.

Music icons Madonna, Elton John bury old hatchet: A healing momentMusic titans Madonna and Elton John have ended their decades-long feud after the former artiste paid a visit to John post-performance. Madonna shared a post about the same on her social media handle.
Logout trailer: Babil Khan's thriller is a wake-up call on phone addictionBabil Khan starring Logout trailer released on April 8. The film will premiere on Zee5 on April 18.

Alia Bhatt's latest ad has fans calling her Madhuri Dixit's 'unofficial daughter'Bollywood star Alia Bhatt's latest ad is trending on social media, where she is channelling a 90s vibe. The actor's avatar in the commercial is being praised by fans, with many comparing her with a younger Madhuri Dixit.
SRK, Suhana Khan's King delayed due to script setback: ReportShah Rukh Khan and Suhana Khan's King is reportedly delayed amid script changes. The film is expected to release in theatres in 2026.

Krrish 4: Hrithik Roshan in triple role, reuniting with Preity Zinta | ExclusiveActor Hrithik Roshan will most likely be seen in a triple role in the next Krrish film. The movie will also see him sharing screen space with close friend Preity Zinta once again.

Chef Vikas Khanna backs actor Gaurav Khanna as he gets trolled for copying a dishActor Gaurav Khanna faced criticism over the originality of his dessert on Celebrity MasterChef. However, chef Vikas Khanna has now come out in support of the actor and extended his best wishes to all the contestants of the season.
Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja gets angry over divorce rumours: Dogs will barkGovinda's wife Sunita Ahuja reacted to divorce rumours. Angry with the rumours, Ahuja said, 'dogs will bark.'

Now You See Me: How the magical heist franchise was ahead of its timeThe Now You See Me franchise introduced audiences to a world where magic and heists collided, offering a fresh twist on the crime genre. Before the third film hits the theatres, let us delve into why and what made this franchise stand out.

Allu Arjun turns 43: Icon star greets fans outside his homeTelugu superstar Allu Arjun's birthday turned into a grand fan celebration on Tuesday. A sea of fans gathered outside his residence in Hyderabad, and the actor was seen greeting the crowd and waving to them warmly.

TAPS: How a YouTube film is broadening the understanding of queer lives A short film on YouTube, titled 'TAPS', has travelled across the world through various film festivals. Backed by Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal, it became one of the most seamlessly designed films on gay relationships in India.

Filmmaker Alfonso Cuaron in talks to direct new James Bond movieAcclaimed director Alfonso Cuaron is reportedly in talks to direct the next James Bond movie. While an official announcement is yet to be made, the filmmaker hinted about the project during a recent event.

5 reasons why Allu Arjun and Atlee's big-budget actioner could be a game-changerThe announcement video of Allu Arjun's next with Atlee was more than a birthday special teaser - it offered a glimpse into one of Indian cinema's most ambitious projects. Built with global technicians and futuristic storytelling tools, the mega-budget actioner aims to set a new benchmark for mainstream Indian entertainment.

general news.headline: Raghuram Rajan points out the silver lining for India in US-China trade warIn an interview with India Today TV, Raghuram Rajan urged India to move swiftly but wisely on trade talks with the United States and reform its own tariff structure.

India, China should stand together against US abuse of tariffs: Chinese officialChina urged India to stand united against escalating US tariffs under Trump. As the Trump administration announced a 104 per cent tariffs on Chinese goods, Beijing vowed retaliation, calling Washington's moves unilateral and illegitimate.

104% tariffs imposed on China, confirms White House, effective from todayThe US has escalated its trade confrontation with China with the imposition of 104 per cent tariffs on Chinese imports. The tariffs will come into effect from April 9, the White House confirmed.

Video shows moments before Dominican Republic nightclub roof collapse, killing 79A video shows the final moments before the roof of Jet Set nightclub collapsed during a concert. The footage captures a lively dance performance and a cheering audience, unaware of the impending doom above. In a matter of seconds, it turned into chaos as the roof collapsed, trapping hundreds of people inside.
Gold biscuit to wedding saree, bizarre things Indians left behind in Uber cabsMumbai has dethroned Delhi as the most forgetful city in India, according to Uber's 9th Annual Lost & Found Index.

S&P 500 hits lowest level in one year as hopes for Trump tariff relief fadeThe S&P 500 reached its lowest level in nearly a year after it reversed a strong morning rally, as hopes faded for any concessions or delays on President Donald Trump's global tariffs on US's trading partners set to come into effect on April 9.

Mahua Moitra claims fish shops shut, traders threatened at Delhi market; BJP reactsTMC's Mahua Moitra claimed that BJP leaders were threatening fish traders for running their business next to a temple in Delhi's Chittaranjan Park, a Bengali-dominated area. The BJP accused Moitra of trying to disturb communal harmony and police said the matter was under enquiry.

Priyansh-powered PBKS hand 4th straight loss to CSK despite Dhoni cameoIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was the star of the show as Punjab Kings defeated Chennai Super Kings and handed them a fourth loss on the trot on Tuesday, April 8. MS Dhoni's cameo wasn't enough in the end as Punjab got their first win at home.

Thai restaurant offers discount if you're 'skinny'. So disrespectful, says InternetChiang Mai Breakfast World in Chiang Mai has introduced a challenge where diners can get up to a 20 per cent discount on their bill if they can squeeze through a series of narrow vertical metal bars.

Rajasthan's Barmer sizzles at 46.4°C amid heatwave, yellow alert in Delhi todayRajasthan's Barmer recorded a scorching 46.4 degrees Celsius, making the place the hottest in the country as a searing heatwave swept several parts of India. In Delhi, where the temperature crossed the 40-degree mark, a yellow alert is in place for today.

Boys will be boys: White House reacts to Musk vs Navarro tariff feudElon Musk called Trump adviser Peter Navarro a "moron" over tariff comments. The White House downplayed the clash, calling it a difference of opinion.

How Supreme Court cleared 10 Bills using extraordinary powersThe Supreme Court on Tuesday used its extraordinary powers to clear 10 Bills. It criticised Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi's "pocket veto" of the Bills, and resorted to Article 142, which was rarely used before, for "complete justice". The use of Article 142 had earlier been criticised as "judicial overreach".

Video: UP man lies on track, lets train pass over him for Instagram reel; arrestedIn Unnao, Uttar Pradesh, a youth named Ranjeet Chaurasia risked his life by lying on a railway track to shoot a reel, as a train passed over him. He added a song from Shah Rukh Khan's film Baadshah to the video and shared it on Instagram, seeking fame.

Trump signs executive orders to revive US coal industry amid rising power demandDonald Trump signed executive orders to revive the US coal industry, invoking emergency powers and ending leasing moratoriums, despite environmental concerns and declining coal use in favour of cheaper, cleaner energy.

Rare 10-carat blue diamond stuns at $100 million exhibition in Abu DhabiA rare 10-carat blue diamond from South Africa drew global attention at Sotheby's $100 million diamond exhibition in Abu Dhabi. The gem could fetch $20 million at auction in May.
Kunal Kamra 'would rather check into mental hospital' than be on Bigg BossComedian Kunal Kamra shared a post on social media and revealed that he has been approached for the new season of Bigg Boss.

Who is Priyansh Arya? 24-year-old PBKS batter hits record IPL hundredIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was at his very best when he scored a 39-ball hundred for the Punjab Kings in their match against the Chennai Super Kings on Tuesday in Mullanpur.

Why temple ruins spotted in MP are a fascinating archaeological findRestoration of the 15 temples dating back to the 11th and 12th century is on, with plans to put the forested site on the state's ecotourism map

5 IAS aspirants injured after car rams pedestrians in Delhi, students lead protestSix people, including five IAS aspirants, were injured after a speeding Hyundai i10 car rammed pedestrians in Delhi's Old Rajinder Nagar. While five those injured are expected to be discharged soon, one may require more treatment.
Blankets distribution in 40 degrees Celsius: Bihar BJP minister's gesture goes viralA BJP minister distributed blankets in Bihar while the temperature soared to 40 degrees Celsius.

Pooran, Marsh fireworks hurt KKR in Eden thriller as LSG climb to top fourIPL 2025, KKR vs LSG: Kolkata Knight Riders lost a high-scoring thriller to Lucknow Super Giants by 4 runs. Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh's fireworks helped the visiting team post a winning total of 238 at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, April 8.

Picasso vs Nazis: The rebel artist who redefined war, art and freedomPablo Picasso, who died on April 8, 1973, left behind not just paintings, but explosive stories of exile, rebellion, humour and genius. Behind his fame was a man of contradictions—brilliant, obsessive, wildly witty, and at times cruel.

Manipur MLA survives attack by drug smugglers: They grabbed hand, tried choking meNational People's Party MLA Noorul Hassan was attacked by drug smugglers on April 5 when he was leaving his sister's house after a family dinner. He recalled the sequence of events, saying the attackers grabbed his hand and tried to choke him.

Alien Enemies Act explained: Trump revives 1798 law to push deportationsThe Supreme Court has cleared the way for the Trump administration to use a centuries-old law to deport Venezuelan migrants accused of gang ties—but added a key safeguard: those facing deportation must be given a chance to defend themselves.

sports.headline: Markram gives insights into plan to counter Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil NarineLucknow Super Giants (LSG) batter Aiden Markram gave insights into their plan to counter Sunil Narine and Varun Chakravarthy's threat in the game against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Markram scored 47 (28) and added 99 runs for the first wicket with Mitchell Marsh as LSG beat KKR by four runs.

Samson's captaincy comeback had calming influence on squad: Shane BondRajasthan Royals (RR) assistant and fast bowling coach Shane Bond feels Sanju Samson's comeback as captain has had a calming influence on the entire team. Samson finally returned as captain and wicketkeeper for Rajasthan in the previous game after playing first three matches as an Impact Substitute due to injury.

Washington Sundar in awe of GT bowlers: Restricting teams to below 180 is amazingIPL 2025, GT vs RR: In the press conference before the match against Rajasthan Royals, Washington Sundar heaped praise on the Gujarat Titans' bowlers for their wholehearted efforts.

How Shreyas Iyer chat helped Priyansh Arya score 39-ball hundred vs CSKPriyansh Arya revealed the chat he had with Shreyas Iyer which helped him to score his maiden IPL hundred against CSK on Tuesday, April 8. Priyansh's knock helped PBKS secure a big win at home against Chennai.

MS Dhoni fan bursts into tears as CSK loses fourth on the trot vs Punjab KingsA MS Dhoni fan was seen crying in the stands after Chennai Super Kings (CSK) lost their fourth consecutive match in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Punjab Kings in Chandigarh.

Neeraj Chopra to begin season with Doha Diamond League on May 16Neeraj Chopra is all set to take part in the Doha Diamond League, which is set to take place on May 16. Chopra triumphed at the Qatar Sports Club in 2023, setting a world-leading throw of 88.67m.

After Tilak Varma, Devon Conway retires out in tense run-chaseIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Devon Conway retired out on 69 runs, but the Chennai Super Kings slumped to an 18-run defeat to the Punjab Kings at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.

Priyansh-powered PBKS hand 4th straight loss to CSK despite Dhoni cameoIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was the star of the show as Punjab Kings defeated Chennai Super Kings and handed them a fourth loss on the trot on Tuesday, April 8. MS Dhoni's cameo wasn't enough in the end as Punjab got their first win at home.

Sundar annoyed with question in GT vs RR presser: When did I say that?IPL 2025: Washington Sundar was visibly not happy with a question from a journalist in the press conference before Gujarat Titans' match against Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday in Ahmedabad.

Rishabh Pant explains decision to not bat, says right-left call worked for LSGIPL 2025, LSG vs KKR: Rishabh Pant did not bat during the entire 20 overs, choosing instead to hold himself back. LSG posted 238 on the board and successfully defended it for 2 points in Kolkata.

Our curator has enough publicity: KKR captain Rahane dodges pitch questionKKR captain Ajinkya Rahane dodged questions about the pitch in Kolkata after their 4-run loss to LSG on Tuesday, April 8. The Eden Gardens curator came under the spotlight after his comments early in the season.

After Tilak Varma, Devon Conway retires out in tense run-chaseIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Devon Conway retired out on 69 runs, but the Chennai Super Kings slumped to an 18-run defeat to the Punjab Kings at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.

Priyansh-powered PBKS hand 4th straight loss to CSK despite Dhoni cameoIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was the star of the show as Punjab Kings defeated Chennai Super Kings and handed them a fourth loss on the trot on Tuesday, April 8. MS Dhoni's cameo wasn't enough in the end as Punjab got their first win at home.

Sundar annoyed with question in GT vs RR presser: When did I say that?IPL 2025: Washington Sundar was visibly not happy with a question from a journalist in the press conference before Gujarat Titans' match against Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday in Ahmedabad.

Rishabh Pant explains decision to not bat, says right-left call worked for LSGIPL 2025, LSG vs KKR: Rishabh Pant did not bat during the entire 20 overs, choosing instead to hold himself back. LSG posted 238 on the board and successfully defended it for 2 points in Kolkata.

Our curator has enough publicity: KKR captain Rahane dodges pitch questionKKR captain Ajinkya Rahane dodged questions about the pitch in Kolkata after their 4-run loss to LSG on Tuesday, April 8. The Eden Gardens curator came under the spotlight after his comments early in the season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
